The claim states that none of the: 400 million proposed by the City of Austin for road projects will be used to add new lanes to congested roadways.
Jim Skaggs: the treasurer of Citizens Against Rail Taxes, points out that the ad specifies no new lanes on the city's congested roads, specifically mentioning MoPac Boulevard, I-35, and U.S. 183.
City and Texas Department of Transportat: 400 million would result in about 15 miles of new or extended lanes, contradicting the claim.
City spokeswoman Samantha Alexander ment: including easing access to and from I-35, projects related to Texas 71, and a single new lane on part of FM 1826 in Southwest Austin.
